intro: Dilobeia tenuinervis, commonly known as the slender-veined dilobeia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gesneriaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with prominent, slender veins. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, often clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
